<< relativepath files and folders functions

rmdir

Removes a directory.

Syntax

rmdir(dirname)
rmdir(dirname, '-s')
res = dir(dirname)
res = rmdir(dirname, 's')
[res, msg] = dir(dirname)
[res, msg] = rmdir(dirname, 's')

Input argument

dirname

a string: file or directory name.

's'

a string: removes also subdirectories.

Output argument

res

a logical: true or false.

msg

a string: error message or ''.

Description

res = rmdir(dirname) removes the directory dirname.

If the directory is not empty, you must use the s argument.

Example

mkdir([tempdir(), '/test'])
rmdir([tempdir(), '/test'])

See also

isdir, mkdir.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
